info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 24 at 3:20PM EDT until July 24 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...NORTHEASTERN CLARION AND SOUTHERN FOREST COUNTIES... At 320 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles southwest of Marienville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Marienville, Fryburg, Leeper, Clarington, Clear Creek State Park, and Cook Forest State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
